lead_paragraph: More than two feet of snow could hit the Washington region starting Friday, then the storm will move north, with about a foot of snow expected in New York.

byline.contributor: Sheryl Gay Stolberg reported from Washington, and Katie Rogers from New York. Reporting was contributed by Nicholas Fandos from Washington, Gary Gately from Baltimore and Christine Hauser from New York.
byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and KATIE ROGERS

headline.main: Bracing for a Blizzard, From the Deep South to the Northeast

snippet: More than two feet of snow could hit the Washington region starting Friday, then the storm will move north, with about a foot of snow expected in New York.
abstract: Governors of Georgia, North Carolina, Maryland, Pennsylvania and Virginia declare states of emergency in advance of blizzard that is expected to batter mid-Atlantic states; residents all along coast stock up on supplies in preparation for blizzard, particularly in Washington, DC, which is notorious for handling large snowfalls badly.
